Message.Title: Is Nvidia eyeing ST-Ericsson?
Message.Msg: Interesting that ST is looking to exit ST-Ericsson partnership, at least as a shareholder. Yet another semi player (ST) that wants to focus on Analog and get away from Digital. 2012 has made it clear that Nvidia needs to either go big or, go home. I wonder if NVDA will be spending a chunk of its cash on buying the wireless division?

Topic.Title: Google picks Broadcom for Nexus 4 and Nexus 10

Message.Msg: "We'll make sure we're very competitive or even the best", says Qualcomm. Sounds like nvidia could learn a Lot from Qualcomm.

Topic.Title: Qualcomm Resolves Chipset Crisis

Message.Msg: Say! Maybe Qualcomm should BUNDLE their now-plentiful Snapdraqgon S4 chips with their brand-new Qualcomm NFC controller chip. Everybody needs a nice stack controller chip too, right? Like a flashlight and batteries -- they go together. And the customer could get All of their shopping done in one place. Which is nice -- what with the malls being so crowded and all. Qualcomm Snapdragons + Qualcomm NFC controller chips. It's a Winning combination.

Message.Msg: Half the stock is all cash, no debt and business going at 5 forward PE while gorwing in tablet and phones at 70 - 80% rate.

Topic.Title: Wayne news: HTC to be the first with NVIDIA Tegra 4 phone?

Message.Msg: 'on topic' - as on topic as brain dead partisanship sound bites. let the gullible chomp on posts like that. brcm a full year ago completely dismissed nvda's processor efforts and said that the fight will be between them and qcom. In their analyst day last thrusday, they finally spilled the beans on what they are doing in mobile. they gave a full 2 hour presentation on that. For anyone interested in mobile, he owes it to himself to listen to that presentation/Q&A to see the full meaning of what 'making a SoC' means. eg. while nvda will never be able to touch the #1 & #2 in mobile, brcm's already selling tons to samsung, with samsung using their integrated processor in current and future phones. eg. I don't have much doubt sooner or later amzn will go brcm too, with the exception that brcm, unlike other SoC vendors to amzn, will be making good margins off their integrated solutions. the only guy who can touch that would be samsung if samsung need fab fills to replace aapl wafers. With # 1, 2, & 3 out of nvda,s reach, #4 in for spreading the wealth, Jen does not have enough 'cheap radios' to play in this game and attack anything below the leading edge. Time for nvda to run this thing like a real business, fold tegra, and just license their graphics.

Topic.Title: And this, boys, is why we don't listen to best

Message.Msg: If it continues to be accumulated and we have this fiscal cliff thing resolved (mostly) then the pull backs will be limited. Assumptions are being made about the real valuation against market trends. Any news that shows Nvidia is not losing but continuing to gain share will only reinforce a higher tier for the stock price. We had been pushed down to new low already so I think we are trending upward into next year.

Topic.Title: And this, boys, is why we don't listen to best

Message.Msg: Limited or not they will be there and as I said you can sell puts or or a bull put spread all the way up even if the pull backs are limited. Secondly, although I fundamentally believe in NVDA as I think the stock will be @ 30 before it's @ 10 I don't expect pullbacks not to occur. Keep in mind December/January are historically the 2 most DOW positive months for stocks in addition to China speculation and maybe CES . I would be shocked if this stock went full steam ahead and broke out of every resistance level without a few pull backs but absolutely agree with you overall the stock will trend higher. 13 by early mid January. I am going to add another 5k on the pullback or possibly if it moves as you suggest just write bull spreads.

Topic.Title: Here is why all the pathetic Best losers are WRONG!

Message.Msg: "For a supposed High Tech / High Growth company like nvidia purports to be, it's just plain dumb for Jen to be holding onto so much excess cash. Yes boys, just plain cash-inefficiently, dumb." It looks like you did it again, Master. You publicly shamed Jen into parting with some cash today. You know, like you shamed him into paying his first-ever-in-19 years cash dividend. With your classic piece, "Jeepers Best, Everybody else pays a dividend." But this time you caused Jen to finally try out that stock repurchase program. By calling him "a just plain cash-inefficiently dumb manager." Right here on this very board. And Jen responded too -- just as he's been trained by Best. One million shares at 1:00. Now granted, that's a bit weak -- well, let's not prevaricate here -- it's Extremely Weak, but Jen's a novice at this stock buy-back stuff, right? Can we see Two million shares a 2:00 tommorrow? We hope so.
